trans-unit.source: Using New Relic with Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Using New Relic with Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the New Relic service to manage and monitor your Azure application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the New Relic service to manage and monitor your Azure application.

trans-unit.source: New Relic Application Performance Management on Azure
trans-unit.target: New Relic Application Performance Management on Azure

trans-unit.source: This guide describes how to add New Relic's world-class performance
trans-unit.target: This guide describes how to add New Relic's world-class performance

trans-unit.source: monitoring to your Azure hosted applications.
trans-unit.target: monitoring to your Azure hosted applications.

trans-unit.source: We'll cover the fast and simple
trans-unit.target: We'll cover the fast and simple

trans-unit.source: process to add New Relic to your application and introduce you to some of
trans-unit.target: process to add New Relic to your application and introduce you to some of

trans-unit.source: New Relic's features.
trans-unit.target: New Relic's features.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using New Relic, see <link><linkText>Using New Relic</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using New Relic, see <link><linkText>Using New Relic</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: What is New Relic?
trans-unit.target: What is New Relic?

trans-unit.source: New Relic is a developer focused tool that monitors your production applications
trans-unit.target: New Relic is a developer focused tool that monitors your production applications

trans-unit.source: and provides deep insight into their performance and reliability.
trans-unit.target: and provides deep insight into their performance and reliability.

trans-unit.source: It is
trans-unit.target: It is

trans-unit.source: designed to save you time when identifying and diagnosing performance issues, and
trans-unit.target: designed to save you time when identifying and diagnosing performance issues, and

trans-unit.source: it puts the information you need to solve these issues at your fingertips.
trans-unit.target: it puts the information you need to solve these issues at your fingertips.

trans-unit.source: New Relic tracks the load time and throughput for your web transaction, both from
trans-unit.target: New Relic tracks the load time and throughput for your web transaction, both from

trans-unit.source: the server and your users' browsers.
trans-unit.target: the server and your users' browsers.

trans-unit.source: It shows how much time you spend in the
trans-unit.target: It shows how much time you spend in the

trans-unit.source: database, analyzes slow queries and web requests, provides uptime monitoring and
trans-unit.target: database, analyzes slow queries and web requests, provides uptime monitoring and

trans-unit.source: alerting, tracks application exceptions, and a whole lot more.
trans-unit.target: alerting, tracks application exceptions, and a whole lot more.

trans-unit.source: New Relic special pricing through the Azure Store
trans-unit.target: New Relic special pricing through the Azure Store

trans-unit.source: New Relic Standard is free to Azure users
trans-unit.target: New Relic Standard is free to Azure users

trans-unit.source: New Relic Pro is offered based on instance size for Azure Cloud Services
trans-unit.target: New Relic Pro is offered based on instance size for Azure Cloud Services

trans-unit.source: For pricing information see the <link><linkText>New Relic page in the Azure Store</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For pricing information see the <link><linkText>New Relic page in the Azure Store</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Pricing is only listed for up to 10 compute instances.
trans-unit.target: Pricing is only listed for up to 10 compute instances.

trans-unit.source: For counts greater than 10 please contact New Relic (sales@newrelic.com) for volume pricing.
trans-unit.target: For counts greater than 10 please contact New Relic (sales@newrelic.com) for volume pricing.

trans-unit.source: Azure customers receive a 2 week trial subscription of New Relic Pro when they deploy the New Relic agent.
trans-unit.target: Azure customers receive a 2 week trial subscription of New Relic Pro when they deploy the New Relic agent.

trans-unit.source: Sign up for New Relic using the Azure Store
trans-unit.target: Sign up for New Relic using the Azure Store

trans-unit.source: New Relic integrates seamlessly with Azure Web Roles and Worker roles.
trans-unit.target: New Relic integrates seamlessly with Azure Web Roles and Worker roles.

trans-unit.source: To sign up for New Relic directly from the Azure Store, follow these three easy steps.
trans-unit.target: To sign up for New Relic directly from the Azure Store, follow these three easy steps.

trans-unit.source: Step 1. Sign up through the Azure Store
trans-unit.target: Step 1. Sign up through the Azure Store

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the lower pane of the management portal, click New.
trans-unit.target: In the lower pane of the management portal, click New.

trans-unit.source: Click Store.
trans-unit.target: Click Store.

trans-unit.source: In the Choose an Add-on dialog, select New Relic and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Choose an Add-on dialog, select New Relic and click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Personalize Add-on dialog, select the New Relic plan that you want.
trans-unit.target: In the Personalize Add-on dialog, select the New Relic plan that you want.

trans-unit.source: Enter a promotion code, if applicable.
trans-unit.target: Enter a promotion code, if applicable.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for how the New Relic service will appear in your Azure
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for how the New Relic service will appear in your Azure

trans-unit.source: settings, or use the default value NewRelic.
trans-unit.target: settings, or use the default value NewRelic.

trans-unit.source: This name must be unique in
trans-unit.target: This name must be unique in

trans-unit.source: your list of subscribed Azure Store items.
trans-unit.target: your list of subscribed Azure Store items.

trans-unit.source: Choose a value for the region; for example, West US.
trans-unit.target: Choose a value for the region; for example, West US.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Review Purchase dialog, review the plan and pricing information,
trans-unit.target: In the Review Purchase dialog, review the plan and pricing information,

trans-unit.source: and review the legal terms.
trans-unit.target: and review the legal terms.

trans-unit.source: If you agree to the terms, click Purchase.
trans-unit.target: If you agree to the terms, click Purchase.

trans-unit.source: After you click Purchase, your New Relic account will begin the creation process.
trans-unit.target: After you click Purchase, your New Relic account will begin the creation process.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the status in the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the status in the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve your New Relic license key, click Output Values.
trans-unit.target: To retrieve your New Relic license key, click Output Values.

trans-unit.source: Copy the license key that appears.
trans-unit.target: Copy the license key that appears.

trans-unit.source: You will need to enter it when you install the New Relic Nuget package.
trans-unit.target: You will need to enter it when you install the New Relic Nuget package.

trans-unit.source: Step 2. Install the Nuget package
trans-unit.target: Step 2. Install the Nuget package

trans-unit.source: Open your Visual Studio solution, or create a new one by selecting
trans-unit.target: Open your Visual Studio solution, or create a new one by selecting

trans-unit.source: File > New > Project.
trans-unit.target: File > New > Project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you don't already have an Azure Cloud Service Project in your
trans-unit.target: If you don't already have an Azure Cloud Service Project in your

trans-unit.source: solution, add one by right-clicking your app in the Solution Explorer and
trans-unit.target: solution, add one by right-clicking your app in the Solution Explorer and

trans-unit.source: selecting Add Azure Cloud Service Project.
trans-unit.target: selecting Add Azure Cloud Service Project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create cloud service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create cloud service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open the Package Manager console by selecting **Tools > Library Package Manager >
trans-unit.target: Open the Package Manager console by selecting **Tools > Library Package Manager >

trans-unit.source: Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: Set your project to be the Default Project at the
trans-unit.target: Set your project to be the Default Project at the

trans-unit.source: top of the Package Manager Console window.
trans-unit.target: top of the Package Manager Console window.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Package manager console</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Package manager console</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Package Manager command prompt, type `Install-Package
trans-unit.target: On the Package Manager command prompt, type `Install-Package

trans-unit.source: NewRelicWindowsAzure` and press Enter.
trans-unit.target: NewRelicWindowsAzure` and press Enter.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>install in package manager</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>install in package manager</linkText>

trans-unit.source: At the license key prompt, enter the license key you received from the Azure Store.
trans-unit.target: At the license key prompt, enter the license key you received from the Azure Store.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>enter license key</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>enter license key</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Optional: At the application name prompt, enter your app's name as it will
trans-unit.target: Optional: At the application name prompt, enter your app's name as it will

trans-unit.source: appear in New Relic's dashboard.
trans-unit.target: appear in New Relic's dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Or, use your solution name as the default.
trans-unit.target: Or, use your solution name as the default.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>enter application name</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>enter application name</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Solution Explorer, right-click your Azure Cloud Service Project, and select Publish.
trans-unit.target: From the Solution Explorer, right-click your Azure Cloud Service Project, and select Publish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>public the cloud project</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>public the cloud project</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note: If this is your first time deploying this app to Azure, you will be prompted to enter your
trans-unit.target: Note: If this is your first time deploying this app to Azure, you will be prompted to enter your

trans-unit.source: Azure credentials.
trans-unit.target: Azure credentials.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <html></html>Deploying an ASP.NET Web Application to an Azure Website<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <html></html>Deploying an ASP.NET Web Application to an Azure Website<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>publish settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>publish settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Step 3. Check out your application's performance in New Relic.
trans-unit.target: Step 3. Check out your application's performance in New Relic.

trans-unit.source: To view your New Relic dashboard:
trans-unit.target: To view your New Relic dashboard:

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click the Manage button.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click the Manage button.

trans-unit.source: Sign in with your New Relic account email and password.
trans-unit.target: Sign in with your New Relic account email and password.

trans-unit.source: From the New Relic menu bar, select Applications > (application's name).
trans-unit.target: From the New Relic menu bar, select Applications > (application's name).

trans-unit.source: The Monitoring > Overview dashboard automatically appears.
trans-unit.target: The Monitoring > Overview dashboard automatically appears.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Relic monitoring dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Relic monitoring dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After you select an app from the list on your Applications menu, the Overview dashboard shows current app server and browser information.
trans-unit.target: After you select an app from the list on your Applications menu, the Overview dashboard shows current app server and browser information.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Using New Relic
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Using New Relic

trans-unit.source: After you select your app from the list on the Applications menu, the Overview dashboard shows current app server and browser information.
trans-unit.target: After you select your app from the list on the Applications menu, the Overview dashboard shows current app server and browser information.

trans-unit.source: To toggle between the two views, click the App server or Browser button.
trans-unit.target: To toggle between the two views, click the App server or Browser button.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the <html></html>standard New Relic UI<html></html> and <html></html>dashboard drill-down<html></html> functions, the Applications Overview dashboard has additional functions.
